text: Michal Hornstein (September 17, 1920 - April 25, 2016) was a Polish-born Canadian businessman, art collector and philanthropist. He was born in Kraków, Poland. He moved to Canada after surviving the Holocaust (he was of Jewish descent). He became a citizen in 1957. He was known for donating money to art museums and schools in Quebec. In 1984 he was made a Member of the Order of Canada. In 1993, he was made a Knight of the National Order of Quebec. He was made Officer in 2002 and Grand Officer in 2013. Hornstein died at his home in Montreal, Quebec on April 25, 2016, aged 95. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Canadian businesspeople Category:Canadian Jews Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Canadian philanthropists Category:Polish philanthropists Category:Polish businesspeople Category:Jewish businesspeople Category:Jewish philanthropists Category:Naturalized citizens of Canada Category:People from Kraków Category:Polish Jews
